subject: Re: Wolf IQ | Hosting for Criminal Law Group
preview: Hey @allieB!  Just a quick update: I have re-optimized the site using WP Rocket, as the previous method was causing some stability issues.  The new results are looking great, with mobile scores consis

full_threads.body:
Hey @allieB!

Just a quick update: I have re-optimized the site using WP Rocket, as the previous method was causing some stability issues.

The new results are looking great, with mobile scores consistently hitting 89-94 (well within the target of 85-92). Here is the breakdown:

  • Analysis 1: 89-91 Performance Score for Mobile & Desktop
  • Analysis 2: 89-91 Performance Score for Mobile & Desktop
  • Analysis 3: 90-94 Performance Score for Mobile & Desktop

I have also reviewed the site and checked all pages to ensure there are no layout shifts or broken elements. Everything looks stable and optimised 🙏
Thanks @andy - will let VV know 🙏

Thanks Allie.

Can you just get Victoria to draft me an email to Mohamed with that context? Be like, "Hey man, we're happy to cover this free of charge, but it does take our team's time. No worries, just keep us posted. We want to make this site amazing for you."

Thanks so much. Then have a look at the context of what happened underneath.

Hi Mohammed,

Thank you for the update.

We agree that the live user experience and critical elements like enquiry forms must remain stable.

Upon investigation, we identified the root cause as a conflict generated by the performance and speed optimization settings, rather than the design or layout changes themselves. The configurations intended to improve load speed were too aggressive for the live environment, interfering with interactive elements like forms and carousels.

Next Steps:
  • Adjustment: We are adjusting the optimization strategy to deliver updates without these aggressive settings.
  • Testing: We will proceed with strict testing across desktop and mobile to guarantee stability before re-applying changes.

I will update you as soon as the revised solution is ready for review.

@Andy -  Just wanted to give you some context on this one.

Rest assured, we are looking into this immediately and will get back to the client.

What happened: I want to confirm that Marcelo and I fully reviewed the updates together before launch, and the site was optimized and functioning perfectly at that time.

The issues Mohammed reported were not due to our code updates, but rather the Accelerator Plugin we installed to improve the speed and optimise the images. It appears the plugin configuration reacted aggressively in the live environment (or the method has since been patched/conflicted), leading to:
  • Aggressive Caching: The plugin likely served a cached version that clashed with the new layout, making things look broken on mobile even though the underlying code was correct.
  • Minification Conflicts: The plugin "squished" the CSS/JS files too tightly, which prevented the browser from reading instructions for the Carousel and Forms.
  • Script Deferral: To speed up load times, the plugin forced interactive elements to load last, causing buttons and links to become unclickable.

Next Steps & Timeline: Because the plugin method and imagify for optimising the website is proving unstable, we are abandoning that path.
  • We will investigate deeper and switch to manual code tweaks to optimize the site safely.
  • Timeline: Since this involves careful manual adjustments rather than an automated plugin, this will take more than a day to resolve properly to ensure we don't break the layout again.

We will keep you posted.

Hi Allie,
Thank you for the update.
Subsequently, while reviewing the website, we identified a number of functionality issues. In particular, several elements were not working correctly across both mobile and desktop, including the blog section (items not clickable), carousels, parts of the hero area, and enquiry forms.
We spent time with the developer to ensure everything was loading correctly, and the layout has now been restored, with some of the changes made by your team reverted in order to maintain site layout and functionality.
For that reason, could you please re-check the changes on your end, and if any further changes are made, kindly ensure they do not affect critical aspects of the site, including layout, forms, carousels, and overall usability across both desktop and mobile.
Happy to discuss further by phone if helpful.

Kind regards

Mohammed Suliman

Director | Partner

A: Suite 5, 153 George Street, Liverpool NSW 2170

P: PO Box 266 Liverpool NSW 1871

Hi Mohammed,

Thank you so much for your patience, just wanted to share a quick update with you

We’ve successfully improved the site’s PageSpeed performance to 90+
  • Current Google PageSpeed score is 99 (mobile & desktop)
  • You can view the results here: https://pagespeed.web.dev/analysis/https-www-criminallawgroup-com-au/hy3ym0244e?form_factor=mobile

You may notice the “Core Web Vitals Assessment: Failed” message, this is based on historical data.
  • Google updates this assessment as new real-world data is collected
  • This typically refreshes over the next ~30 days, so this will resolve naturally

Overall, performance-wise everything is now in a great place, and we’ll continue monitoring things closely.

Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions at all, always happy to help.

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena
Allie Borcena assigned to Marcelo Meneses

full_threads.body:
Hi Mohammed,

Thanks so much for your note.

We’re on it and have started scheduling the optimisation work. Our team will keep you posted as we progress and let you know once the page has been fully optimised and performance improvements are in place.

Looking forward to getting everything running smoothly for you.

Thanks for the chat yesterday.

As discussed, we will upgrade you from 'Hosting Only' to a Care Plan for the website's success, security, and speed.

I've put the two options below and highlighted in yellow the differences. Please let us know which is best for you.

As part of your onboarding, our team will do an audit too and come back with any flags or things that might need more attention. @Ava W. will send this through next week.

Have a great weekend ahead,
Andy
